final_answer.precision_note: All mean bond energies are given to three significant figures. The final result from the summation and subtraction (2648 - 3462 = -814) is also given to three significant figures, consistent with the precision of the input data.

method: The enthalpy change ($\Delta H$) is estimated using the formula $\Delta H = \sum(\text{Bonds Broken}) - \sum(\text{Bonds Formed})$. Bonds broken (reactants: $\text{CH}_4 + 2\text{O}_2$): $4 \times (\text{C-H}) + 2 \times (\text{O=O}) = 4 \times 413 \text{ kJ mol}^{-1} + 2 \times 498 \text{ kJ mol}^{-1} = 1652 \text{ kJ mol}^{-1} + 996 \text{ kJ mol}^{-1} = 2648 \text{ kJ mol}^{-1}$. Bonds formed (products: $\text{CO}_2 + 2\text{H}_2\text{O}$): $2 \times (\text{C=O}) + 4 \times (\text{O-H}) = 2 \times 805 \text{ kJ mol}^{-1} + 4 \times 463 \text{ kJ mol}^{-1} = 1610 \text{ kJ mol}^{-1} + 1852 \text{ kJ mol}^{-1} = 3462 \text{ kJ mol}^{-1}$. The estimated enthalpy change is $\Delta H = 2648 \text{ kJ mol}^{-1} - 3462 \text{ kJ mol}^{-1} = -814 \text{ kJ mol}^{-1}$. The negative sign indicates an exothermic reaction.
checks: A check on the bond count: Reactants (broken): 4 C-H, 2 O=O. Products (formed): 2 C=O, 4 O-H. The calculation is 2648 - 3462 = -814 kJ mol-1. This is a common value for the estimated enthalpy of methane combustion.
